meanings.definition: Sails set above the royal sails on a square-rigged ship.
meanings.sent1: The skysails fluttered gracefully in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to raise the skysails for more speed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the skysails, thinking it was a perch.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the skysails glowed like golden wings in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the skysails against the blue sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To set or hoist skysails on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors skysailed the ship to catch the favorable wind.
meanings.sent2: They always skysail early in the morning to make good progress.
meanings.sent3: The crew decided to skysail the ship backwards just for fun.
meanings.sent4: She skysailed through the storm, determined to reach the port safely.
meanings.sent5: Skysailing the ship required teamwork and coordination.

meanings.definition: The highest sails on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The skysails towered above the rest of the ship's sails.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the crew secured the skysails to prevent damage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey climbed to the top of the skysails for a better view.
meanings.sent4: In the distance, the enemy ship's skysails could be seen approaching.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor reminisced about his days climbing the skysails.
